DOC.brief_summary: Main aim is to evaluate the role of stress in the evolution of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and the quality of life of these patients. A second aim is to establish the existence of any psicopathological profile in these patients. We designed a prospective experimental study were patients are randomized to receive or not a cognitive-behavior program. Patients will be evaluated at 3 and 12 months after the program and study variables will be measured: stress level, coping strategies, quality of life, activity of disease and biological variables related to IBD.
DOC.brief_title: Stress and Personality Profiles in IBD
DOC.criteria: Age 1885 years Informed consent Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis diagnosis Active disease in the last 18 months Severe mental disease Other severe concomitant disease
